item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, December 23, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Fogus: Things and Stuff of 2024 (68 points | 2 comments)
2. Show HN: Keypub.sh – OAuth for the terminal using SSH keys (57 points | 8 comments)
3. Xerox to acquire Lexmark (136 points | 95 comments)
4. The intricacies of implementing memoization in Ruby (59 points | 22 comments)
5. Neanderthals cold-adapted? Ribcage reconstruction may hold the answer (9 points | discuss)
6. Building a replacement 386/486 CMOS battery (12 points | 1 comment)
7. CLI tool to insert spacers when command output stops (92 points | 16 comments)
8. Happy 400th birthday to the world’s oldest bond (149 points | 18 comments)
9. Tracking Down the Bulgarian Marketplace Scams (33 points | 1 comment)
10. Commercial tea bags release microplastics, entering human cells (168 points | 170 comments)
11. A Life-Saving Checklist (2007) (6 points | 2 comments)
12. Offline Reinforcement Learning for LLM Multi-Step Reasoning (63 points | 7 comments)
13. C++ Is an Absolute Blast (44 points | 34 comments)
14. Can AI do maths yet? Thoughts from a mathematician (166 points | 142 comments)
15. Infinigen: Infinite Photorealistic Worlds Using Procedural Generation (220 points | 27 comments)
16. Journal that published faulty black plastic study removed from science index (49 points | 33 comments)
17. Co-Adapting Human Interfaces and LMs (8 points | discuss)
18. I built a platform for discovering and sharing Chrome extension collections (103 points | 53 comments)
19. Twtxt is a decentralised, minimalist microblogging service for hackers (286 points | 99 comments)
20. Phrack 72 "40th Anniversary Edition" Call for Papers (5 points | 1 comment)
21. GPT-5 is behind schedule (501 points | 893 comments)
22. How bloom filters made SQLite 10x faster (424 points | 76 comments)
23. Why Apple sends spyware victims to this nonprofit security lab (62 points | 23 comments)
24. RAG Logger: An Open-Source Alternative to LangSmith (70 points | 12 comments)
25. Collatz’s Ant (97 points | 7 comments)
26. Decoding the telephony signals in Pink Floyd's 'The Wall' (389 points | 125 comments)
27. Litestack: All your data infrastructure, in one Ruby gem (131 points | 19 comments)
28. Unitree Robot Off-Road (5 points | discuss)
29. Writing and testing a paginated API iterator in Go (46 points | 4 comments)
30. Long Term Software Development (245 points | 118 comments)
